title: Commission Regulation (EEC) No 1411/92 of 27 May 1992 fixing the level of the intervention threshold for cauliflowers, peaches, nectarines and lemons for the 1992/93 marketing year
header:
COMMISSION REGULATION (EEC) No 1411/92  of 27 May 1992  fixing the level of the intervention threshold for cauliflowers, peaches, nectarines and lemons for the 1992/93 marketing year
THE COMMISSION OF THE EUROPEAN COMMUNITIES
main_body:
The level of intervention thresholds for cauliflowers, peaches, nectarines and lemons for the 1992/93 marketing year is fixed as follows:
- cauliflowers: 64 900 tonnes,
- peaches: 280 400 tonnes,
- nectarines: 62 200 tonnes,
- lemons: 367 000 tonnes.

1. The overrun of the intervention threshold for cauliflowers shall be calculated on the basis of interventions carried out between 1 February 1992 and 31 January 1993.
2. The overrun of the intervention threshold for lemons shall be calculated on the basis of interventions carried out between 1 March 1992 and 28 February 1993.

This Regulation shall enter into force on the third day following its publication in the Official Journal of the European Communities. This Regulation shall be binding in its entirety and directly applicable in all Member States.
attachments:
Done at Brussels, 27 May 1992. For the Commission
Ray MAC SHARRY
Member of the Commission
(1) OJ No L 118, 20. 5. 1972, p. 1. (2) OJ No L 150, 15. 6. 1991, p. 8. (3) OJ No L 198, 26. 7. 1988, p. 9. (4) OJ No L 118, 29. 4. 1989, p. 21. (5) OJ No L 119, 11. 5. 1990, p. 61.
